Very early first impressions of OpenAI's ChatGPT Atlas Browser - specifically, Agent Mode:"
""
"Disclaimer: I don't plan on using this browser again, because I'm worried about "prompt injection attacks", but wanted to try it out once."
""
"Task: I asked it to log into ASICS Runkeeper and export my activity (5K run) for today. "
""
"Performance and behavior:"
"- It’s slow, understandably, since it sends screenshots and HTML to the LLM to interpret the page, then makes one or more attempts to find the right element to click or enter input into. "
"- You can see what it's doing, and what it's "thinking", since that is emitted in the chat window. "
"- The agent has access to the LLM's trained knowledge base, and tools (e.g. web searches to gather more information to help complete the task)."
"- You can take over control, hand it back to the agent, or stop it completely."
""
"Limitations:"
"- It won’t enter login credentials, so you have to do that manually."
"- It won’t download files automatically, you have to handle that part yourself."
"- It may ask for confirmation before taking the next action (e.g., which button to click)."
""
"Hiccups:"
"- It struggled with clicking the correct position in a pop up date picker, but got it after three tries. It was trying to determine the X position of the 16th (day of October) to click on it."
"- It made multiple attempts to export the data (re-entering the date range and clicking "Export") and missed the “Download Now!” button a few times, but eventually got it. To be fair, the Runkeeper page design doesn’t make this easy."
"- It can loop a few times, making silly mistakes in finding the right element, before successfully continuing."
""
"Memory and persistence:"
"- Information or special instructions on how to interact with the page do not seem to persist beyond the session. Once the chat ends, it forgets."
"- So, before ending the chat, I asked it to write out instructions I could paste into a prompt later. In a new session, I pasted those same instructions, and it followed them successfully. The instructions seemed to help - I didn't have to intervene at all this time, except for the download (we were already logged in still)."
""
